attributes.additional_details: Council will not spend money to make roads safe while spending millions on top management salaries and council offices.
attributes.background: Shrewsbury and Atcham council have just given a 56% pay rise to chief officer. Salary is now £156,000.00.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is the responsibility of the local council.
	
You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

You could also start a new petition about something the UK Parliament and Government are responsible for. For example, you could start a new petition asking for a cap on the salaries of all council officials in England, if that's what you'd like to happen.
